title: States Ease Mask Mandates, but Should You Still Wear a Mask?
sub_head: Mask rules in the U.S. are shifting again. Here’s how to assess your own risks.
body:
Falling Covid-19 case rates are prompting more states to ease masking requirements. The changes mean that when—or whether—to wear a mask is becoming more of an individual decision.
There are several factors to weigh when making decisions about masking, doctors say. Among them are your own health, the vulnerability of people in your household, local case rates and your vaccination status. Doctors say it can make sense to take precautions even as governments pull back.
